Package basepack

Class Utility

java.lang.Object
basepack.Utility
public class Utility extends Object
The Utility class provides various helper methods for user input and validation.

  • Method Details

    • checkDateValidity

      public boolean checkDateValidity(int checkIn, int checkOut)
      The checkDateValidity() method checks the validity of the check-in and check-out dates.
      Parameters:
      checkIn - The check-in date.
      checkOut - The check-out date.
      Returns:
      True if the dates are valid, false otherwise.

    • getPosNumValue

      public int getPosNumValue(String x)
      The getPosNumValue() method gets the positive integer value of a string.
      Parameters:
      x - The string to evaluate.
      Returns:
      The integer, -1 if invalid input.

      public double getPosDoubleValue(String x)

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty(String x)
      The isEmpty() method checks if a given string is empty.
      Parameters:
      x - The string to evaluate.
      Returns:
      The boolean value. True if null, false otherwise.

    • isPromoValid

      public int isPromoValid(int checkIn, int checkOut, String promoCode)
      The isPromoValid() method checks if a given promo code is applicable, given the conditions of the stay.
      Parameters:
      checkIn - The check-in date.
      checkOut - The check-out date.
      promoCode - The promo code to evaluate.
      Returns:
      The integer corresponding to the type of promo applied, 0 if there is no applicable promo.
